revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-25 14:47:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add internal tenant id in conf

Cinder raw cache feature requires internal tenant id be set in
/etc/cinder/cinder.conf, something like:

cinder_internal_tenant_project_id = b7455b8974bb4064ad247c8f375eae6c
cinder_internal_tenant_user_id = f46924c112a14c80ab0a24a613d95eef

This patch get or create if not exist intenal user id and project id, and then
set in cinder.conf

reference: Cinder cache feature:
https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/blockstorage-image-volume-cache.html

commit_message:
Add internal tenant id in conf

Cinder raw cache feature requires internal tenant id be set in
/etc/cinder/cinder.conf, something like:

cinder_internal_tenant_project_id = b7455b8974bb4064ad247c8f375eae6c
cinder_internal_tenant_user_id = f46924c112a14c80ab0a24a613d95eef

This patch get or create if not exist intenal user id and project id, and then
set in cinder.conf

reference: Cinder cache feature:
https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/blockstorage-image-volume-cache.html

Story: 2004869
Task: 29121
Change-Id: I07954d2efa905a56ca8482d0ec147534c97d01ea
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Move xenial jobs to non voting

There are failing and preventing new work from merging. Move to
non-voting to allow other code to merge.

Change-Id: I90db80ff84e7c777de91ef89b4761564d07c1c8b

(2 comments)

> Could we also see this applied to other OSH services fronted by apache?

This will be basically the same patch over the rest of the services fronted by apache, like horizon, keystone and so on. This is a "test" patch to see if we have an agreement on how to allow deployers and ourselves to maintain multi distro charts.

If you want I can send patches for the rest of the services but I rather wait until this one is rather polished and almost finished :)'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-15 09:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-15 09:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-08 16:01:40.000000000', 'message': 'Allow more generic overrides for nova placement-api

With this patch we allow for a more easy way of overriding some of
the values that may be used in other distros while maintainting the
default values if those values are not overriden

The following values are introduced to be overriden:

conf:
  apache2:
    conf_dir:
    binary:
    extra_flags:
    a2enmod:
    a2dismod:
  nova_placement_apache_config:

On which:
 * conf_dir: directory where to drop the config files for apache vhosts
 * binary: the binary to use for launching apache
 * extra_flags: any flags that will be passed to the apache binary call
 * a2enmod: mods to enable
 * a2dismod: modes to disable
 * nova_placement_apache_config: any extra config for apache

This last key works in sync with an existing feature which is the
override of .Values.pod.mounts.nova_placement.nova_placement to add
more mounts to the pod. This way we can add an extra config to apache
at any time

For a given example, you could override with the following values:

conf:
  nova_placement_apache_config: |
    <Directory "/srv/www">
      Options Indexes FollowSymLinks
      AllowOverride All
    </Directory>
pod:
  mounts:
    nova_placement:
      nova_placement:
        volumeMounts:
          - name: nova-etc
            mountPath: /etc/apache2/conf.d/nova-placement-apache-config.conf
            subPath: nova-placement-apache-config.conf
            readOnly: true

And it would automatically create and put that file in the container.

Notice that if there is no overrides given, it should not affect anything
and the templates will not be changed as the default values are set
to what they used to be

Change-Id: I4fcfde78c5c8fa65956aeae55108ffa1f10e6972

 * mods_dir: directory where to drop any mod configuration

'}, {'created': '2019-03-25 12:58:53.000000000', 'message': 'Allow more generic overrides for nova placement-api

With this patch we allow for a more easy way of overriding some of
the values that may be used in other distros while maintainting the
default values if those values are not overriden

The following values are introduced to be overriden:

conf:
  apache2:
    conf_dir:
    binary:
    extra_flags:
    a2enmod:
    a2dismod:
  nova_placement_apache_config:

On which:
 * conf_dir: directory where to drop the config files for apache vhosts
 * binary: the binary to use for launching apache
 * extra_flags: any flags that will be passed to the apache binary call
 * a2enmod: mods to enable
 * a2dismod: modes to disable
 * nova_placement_apache_config: any extra config for apache

This last key works in sync with an existing feature which is the
override of .Values.pod.mounts.nova_placement.nova_placement to add
more mounts to the pod. This way we can add an extra config to apache
at any time

For a given example, you could override with the following values:

conf:
  nova_placement_apache_config: |
    <Directory "/srv/www">
      Options Indexes FollowSymLinks
      AllowOverride All
    </Directory>
pod:
  mounts:
    nova_placement:
      nova_placement:
        volumeMounts:
          - name: nova-etc
            mountPath: /etc/apache2/conf.d/nova-placement-apache-config.conf
            subPath: nova-placement-apache-config.conf
            readOnly: true

And it would automatically create and put that file in the container.

Notice that if there is no overrides given, it should not affect anything
and the templates will not be changed as the default values are set
to what they used to be

Change-Id: I4fcfde78c5c8fa65956aeae55108ffa1f10e6972

commit_message:
Allow more generic overrides for nova placement-api

With this patch we allow for a more easy way of overriding some of
the values that may be used in other distros while maintainting the
default values if those values are not overriden

The following values are introduced to be overriden:

conf:
  security:
  software:
    apache2:
      conf_dir:
      site_dir:
      mods_dir
      binary:
      extra_flags:
      a2enmod:
      a2dismod:

On which:
 * conf_dir: directory where to drop the config files for apache vhosts
 * site_dir: directory where to drop the enabled virtualhosts
 * mods_dir: directory where to drop any mod configuration
 * binary: the binary to use for launching apache
 * extra_flags: any flags that will be passed to the apache binary call
 * a2enmod: mods to enable
 * a2dismod: mods to disable
 * security: security configuration for apache

Notice that if there is no overrides given, it should not affect anything
and the templates will not be changed as the default values are set
to what they used to be

Change-Id: I4fcfde78c5c8fa65956aeae55108ffa1f10e6972

commit_message:
Fix README syntax to meet PyPI requirements

The sample configuration about caching should be correctly formated in
literal blocks. Otherwise the following checking command(which will be
executed during the openstack releases validating jobs) will fail:

    python setup.py check --restructuredtext --strict

Change-Id: Ic5af30f4d1890cce18bd2212b68f38426274f435
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2019-04-17 01:35:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add middleware generated request_id to context

The RequestId middleware will generate request_id for each request.
This commit adds the request_id to context. If this is not done,
the context will generate another request_id which leads to
inconsistency because there are two request_ids.

Change-Id: Ibca201a19a4ac2c7b6db5ead8459a4a49b571ca2
(cherry picked from commit 1b7763194d74e557f0e7866228effaafe414d5fb)
'}]
commit_message:
Add middleware generated request_id to context

The RequestId middleware will generate request_id for each request.
This commit adds the request_id to context. If this is not done,
the context will generate another request_id which leads to
inconsistency because there are two request_ids.

Change-Id: Ibca201a19a4ac2c7b6db5ead8459a4a49b571ca2
(cherry picked from commit 1b7763194d74e557f0e7866228effaafe414d5fb)

commit_message:
Fix an AttributeError on rebuild

We changed requested_volumes to dict format in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638076/ , but the 'rebuild' code
was not updated which causes this error.

Change-Id: I7dbae54753b5d680d05b9d4b741bad87bd02dd3a
Closes-Bug: #1824513
(cherry picked from commit 0b4617e2b8d77b4f6c0302b61745be775c80d982)

in Barbican secret.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 18:38:59.000000000', 'message': "Add option to disable using oslo_message notifier

Add a configuration option, 'use_oslo_messaging', to indicate whether
to use oslo_messaging notifier. It is set to true for backwards
compatibility.
We can't use audit middleware with services like Swift, which have no
dependency on Oslo and does not work well with oslo_log. Swift uses rsyslog.
Currently, audit middleware indiscriminately chooses oslo_messaging if the
package is installed. This is problematic if Swift proxy is on the same
controller as any service which consumes oslo_messaging. With this new option,
Swift can now safely consume audit middleware by electing to use local
log notifier instead of oslo_messaging.

Change-Id: I87bf857c20e4b78e97d40dcc51a1b4ff0014abb2
Closes-Bug: #1695038
(cherry picked from commit e83bd0bc3c7973e45b677c1c7007770e3f4873b4)

commit_message:
Add option to disable using oslo_message notifier

Add a configuration option, 'use_oslo_messaging', to indicate whether
to use oslo_messaging notifier. It is set to true for backwards
compatibility.
We can't use audit middleware with services like Swift, which have no
dependency on Oslo and does not work well with oslo_log. Swift uses rsyslog.
Currently, audit middleware indiscriminately chooses oslo_messaging if the
package is installed. This is problematic if Swift proxy is on the same
controller as any service which consumes oslo_messaging. With this new option,
Swift can now safely consume audit middleware by electing to use local
log notifier instead of oslo_messaging.

Change-Id: I87bf857c20e4b78e97d40dcc51a1b4ff0014abb2
Closes-Bug: #1695038
(cherry picked from commit e83bd0bc3c7973e45b677c1c7007770e3f4873b4)

commit_message:
Inject validation roles path in ansible config

In order to allow access to the roles provided by tripleo-validations,
we have to inject its path in the generated ansible configuration.

We also inject tripleo-validations library paths.

Change-Id: Ic73411ab5a30a57e3e33a9990fa6b3ecea3ee389
Implements: blueprint inflight-validations

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
fix olso memcache configurations

enable memcache need to pass enable=true explictly
to olso::cache, otherwise, the memcache_servers does
not take effect

Change-Id: I679a4a9c25389d1f4d6c84e44a25c5b781d54850
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>

commit_message:
DVR: Correctly change MTU in fip namespace

The code that ensures the fpr/rfp veth pair exists
between the qrouter and fip namespace was only setting
the mtu of the devices if it had to create them.  Set
it all the time to support the mtu being changed.

Change-Id: I176b5f4d4f12cf09f930e2c1944e98082a09bcc6
Closes-bug: #1823798
(cherry picked from commit 6ded6d217adf61216fb10383d0150c966b92f11c)

commit_message:
DVR: Correctly change MTU in fip namespace

The code that ensures the fpr/rfp veth pair exists
between the qrouter and fip namespace was only setting
the mtu of the devices if it had to create them.  Set
it all the time to support the mtu being changed.

Change-Id: I176b5f4d4f12cf09f930e2c1944e98082a09bcc6
Closes-bug: #1823798
(cherry picked from commit 6ded6d217adf61216fb10383d0150c966b92f11c)

commit_message:
DVR: Correctly change MTU in fip namespace

The code that ensures the fpr/rfp veth pair exists
between the qrouter and fip namespace was only setting
the mtu of the devices if it had to create them.  Set
it all the time to support the mtu being changed.

Change-Id: I176b5f4d4f12cf09f930e2c1944e98082a09bcc6
Closes-bug: #1823798
(cherry picked from commit 6ded6d217adf61216fb10383d0150c966b92f11c)

commit_message:
DVR: Correctly change MTU in fip namespace

The code that ensures the fpr/rfp veth pair exists
between the qrouter and fip namespace was only setting
the mtu of the devices if it had to create them.  Set
it all the time to support the mtu being changed.

Change-Id: I176b5f4d4f12cf09f930e2c1944e98082a09bcc6
Closes-bug: #1823798
(cherry picked from commit 6ded6d217adf61216fb10383d0150c966b92f11c)

commit_message:
Convert tripleo-buildcontainers to a role

Needs to be done so it can be reused in different
repos like [1], [2].

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/20144/
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/20031/

Also use seperate venv for build-containers as venv
created by tripleo-repos role uses become: true.

Change-Id: Ia627b7e128608a5897f9607aca831380278cd785

commit_message:
[searchlight] final releases for pike

This is a procedural review to tag a final release for each deliverables ; and

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: I6d72c57fdc58623a7ce89d6320d703b1acfd6210

commit_message:
add cirros image to libvirt nodepool node

When executing the reproducer against libvirt
where the image is not prepared by dib and nodepool
the cirros image is missing and needs to be added
to the expected path.

Closes-Bug: #1824243
Change-Id: I9201b029b2f4ad03a3c3cd4ce7cfae24a0851dcd

I'm currently working on resolving differences between Nova's lvm code and Cinder's (in os-brick) and consolidating the API between the 2. 

The plan:
1) update the lvm code in os-brick with needed changes for Nova
2) update os-brick lvm code to use privsep
3) release new os-brick with updated lvm code
4) update the cinder lvm removal patch, and update the lvm driver to make use of any changes in os brick's lvm code.
5) post a Nova patch that removes the lvm code."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-03-23 13:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Remove local_dev from cinder

This patch removes the last remnants of the brick embedded library
local_dev.  The local_dev just contained the lvm management class
that is used to create local volume groups and lvm volumes.

This patch needs the os-brick 0.8.0 and >

The os-brick patch that includes the local_dev code:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/260739/

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/652797
Change-Id: I35cc6fcdde56aff72c7d99430d072a7724ae6c21

if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

creating the pike-em tag

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

commit_message:
Do not call update_device_list in large sets

Ovs-agent can process the ports in large sets, then all
of these ports will have to update DB status or attributes.
But neutron server is centralized. It may have to do
something else, or the database processing can be also
time-consuming. Because of these, it sometimes returns
the RPC timeout exception to ovs-agent. And a fullsync
will be triggered in next rpc loop. The restart time is
becoming longer and longer.

Adds a default step to update the port to reduce
the probability of RPC timeout.

Related-Bug: #1813703
Related-Bug: #1813704
Related-Bug: #1813706
Related-Bug: #1813707

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_rpc.py

Change-Id: Ie37f4a4869969e235ce16b73cdfcbdc98626823e
(cherry picked from commit 8408af4f173a0ffde354599e26c49bf9e17e8bef)
(cherry picked from commit d7d30ea950844f11348fa2827908622e3a8c7dfb)
(cherry picked from commit 5d705468de1e495639f8b87266ccfc9391ce6135)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 16:22:21.000000000', 'message': 'Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py
      nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The (test_)request_spec.py conflicts are due to not
having change I2a78f0754c63381c57e7e1c610d0938b6df0f537 in Pike.
The test_conductor.py conflict is due to not having change
I70b11dd489d222be3d70733355bfe7966df556aa in Pike.

NOTE(mriedem): The functional test is adjusted slightly to pass
a string rather than list to _wait_for_migration_status since
change I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12 is not in Pike.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit e4c998e57390c15891131205f7443fee98dde4ee)
(cherry picked from commit 76dfb9d0b6cee1bbb553d3ec11139ca99a6f9474)
(cherry picked from commit 31c08d0c7dc73bb2eefc69fa0f014b6478f3d149)
(cherry picked from commit 8f1773a7af273e2739843a804fb4fe718c0a242d)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py
      nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The (test_)request_spec.py conflicts are due to not
having change I2a78f0754c63381c57e7e1c610d0938b6df0f537 in Pike.
The test_conductor.py conflict is due to not having change
I70b11dd489d222be3d70733355bfe7966df556aa in Pike.

NOTE(mriedem): The functional test is adjusted slightly to pass
a string rather than list to _wait_for_migration_status since
change I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12 is not in Pike.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit e4c998e57390c15891131205f7443fee98dde4ee)
(cherry picked from commit 76dfb9d0b6cee1bbb553d3ec11139ca99a6f9474)
(cherry picked from commit 31c08d0c7dc73bb2eefc69fa0f014b6478f3d149)
(cherry picked from commit 8f1773a7af273e2739843a804fb4fe718c0a242d)

commit_message:
[murano] final releases for pike

This is a procedural review to tag a final release for each deliverables ; and

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: I07876c9df218574b9e5da310ee6d49e050e0707e

Release monasca-notification 1.17.0

This includes a fix to include the Jira plugin in the project
requirements since it is now required out of the box.

Change-Id: I41598789c4a3607acae662aecb593fdc134654c9

[{'created': '2019-04-12 07:08:20.000000000', 'message': "Choose random value for HA routes' vr_id

HA routers are using keepalived and needs to have virtual_router_id
configured. As routers which belongs to same tenant are using same
ha network, those values have to be different for each router.

Before this patch this value was always taken as first available value
from available_vr_ids range.
In some (rare) cases, when more than one router is created in parallel
for same tenant it may happen that those routers would have same vr_id
choosen so keepalived would treat them as single application and only
one router would be ACTIVE on one of L3 agents.

This patch changes this behaviour that now random value from available
vr_ids will be chosen instead of taking first value always.
That should mittigate this rare race condition that it will be (almost)
not noticable for users.

However, proper fix should be probably done as some additional
constraint in database layer. But such solution wouldn't be possible to
backport to stable branches so I decided to propose this easy patch
first.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py

commit_message:
Choose random value for HA routes' vr_id

HA routers are using keepalived and needs to have virtual_router_id
configured. As routers which belongs to same tenant are using same
ha network, those values have to be different for each router.

Before this patch this value was always taken as first available value
from available_vr_ids range.
In some (rare) cases, when more than one router is created in parallel
for same tenant it may happen that those routers would have same vr_id
choosen so keepalived would treat them as single application and only
one router would be ACTIVE on one of L3 agents.

This patch changes this behaviour that now random value from available
vr_ids will be chosen instead of taking first value always.
That should mittigate this rare race condition that it will be (almost)
not noticable for users.

However, proper fix should be probably done as some additional
constraint in database layer. But such solution wouldn't be possible to
backport to stable branches so I decided to propose this easy patch
first.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py

Change-Id: Idb0ed744e54976dca23593fb2d7317bf77442e65
Related-Bug: #1823314
(cherry picked from commit a8d0f557d504957aeb91f451105cca9eee2d6adb)
(cherry picked from commit ee2ed681c495c4fc5086d761853731b7dc2fd34f)
(cherry picked from commit 72c9a7ef8416f894a85a36c6b5bbf995e48599d1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 16:22:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1669054

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts value.
This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only a few
compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an evacuation
can fail if the only available host is the one being ignored.

This adds a functional regression recreate test for the bug.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport differs slightly in that 204 is added
to the default check_response_status POST call which was added in
Queens change I6a51542216340299d250576714e303f74e0ceb0f.

Change-Id: I6ce2d6b1baf47796f867aede1acf292ec9739d6d
Related-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit 556cf103b22ab6bebecc9d824d6f918cda38fe3e)
(cherry picked from commit 20c1414945db633ed00c1f19f1f0d163028454d9)
(cherry picked from commit 77164128bf5eef53b49547658be2ef902c020207)
(cherry picked from commit 9fd4082d7c076146ec314b86e0e4772d0a021712)
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1669054

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts value.
This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only a few
compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an evacuation
can fail if the only available host is the one being ignored.

This adds a functional regression recreate test for the bug.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport differs slightly in that 204 is added
to the default check_response_status POST call which was added in
Queens change I6a51542216340299d250576714e303f74e0ceb0f.

Change-Id: I6ce2d6b1baf47796f867aede1acf292ec9739d6d
Related-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit 556cf103b22ab6bebecc9d824d6f918cda38fe3e)
(cherry picked from commit 20c1414945db633ed00c1f19f1f0d163028454d9)
(cherry picked from commit 77164128bf5eef53b49547658be2ef902c020207)
(cherry picked from commit 9fd4082d7c076146ec314b86e0e4772d0a021712)

If USE_NEUTRON is True, we should be using the NeutronFixture
and not starting the nova-network service or stubbing out

commit_message:
Fix functional tests for USE_NEUTRON

If USE_NEUTRON is True, we should be using the NeutronFixture
and not starting the nova-network service or stubbing out
fake networks in the nova database.

This makes that change and fixes the fallout in busted tests.

Change-Id: I9b35ed7497db8bd1eb74f4bb89631aabbcfeec0d
(cherry picked from commit c5ea3fb41bc36f0f07e7bef55c2bb67770a03d36)

commit_message:
Avoid loading same service plugin more than once

In patch [1] requirement that only each service plugin
can be loaded only once was removed.
Unfortunatelly it is not possible that same service plugin
will be instantiate more than once because it may reqister some
callbacks or other things which can't be duplicated.

So this patch adds mechanism which will ensure that each service
plugin class is instantiate only once and reused if necessary.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626561/

Closes-Bug: #1816771

Change-Id: Ie6e6cc1bbbe50ff7cfad4e8033e48711569ea020
(cherry picked from commit d802fad8a92625005597ebda4931b0bbe13418e9)

commit_message:
Add dependency for service plugin

Adds a required list 'required_service_plugins' to each service plugin,
then we can initialize the service plugin with required dependency.
And also adds the 'router' plugin to port forwarding service plugin
required list.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_floating_ip_port_forwarding.py

Closes-Bug: #1809238
Change-Id: I53fdaee0cd96a5315a7abc39799657d613eb3a2e
(cherry picked from commit e8b7e768a2545621ee98511b8dd271c5117f76bd)

commit_message:
Change dns server to match that used in OVB

Changing the second dns server to 1.1.1.1 - which is
the same as is specified in custom nameserver for
OVB in RDO Cloud.

Related-Bug: #1824772

commit_message:
debian: add support

This patch adds the Debian jobs for this role to make sure
it's always passing as well as updates the meta to reflect
it's support of Debian accordingly.

commit_message:
Fix an AttributeError on rebuild

We changed requested_volumes to dict format in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638076/ , but the 'rebuild' code
was not updated which causes this error.

Change-Id: I7dbae54753b5d680d05b9d4b741bad87bd02dd3a

commit_message:
Add middleware generated request_id to context

The RequestId middleware will generate request_id for each request.
This commit adds the request_id to context. If this is not done,
the context will generate another request_id which leads to
inconsistency because there are two request_ids.

Change-Id: Ibca201a19a4ac2c7b6db5ead8459a4a49b571ca2

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I7a94e085499d98fc84ea8686bc66f12e2b183f0d

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I94a5c6ed319f85168b4f069c9aa0a9062bdde5c0

commit_message:
Changes to include broker connector configuration.

Changes were done to include multiple ssl_profiles
which can be used to by both listeners and connectors.
Also autolink configuration is added to enable
external broker connection.

Change-Id: Ib3090c01bfdcb60168dd1c6db23c520a103c051e
(cherry picked from commit b6228764a1fa5144e816755e9d9e3a59cb432572)

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-28 21:40:41.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Flavor extra spec and image properties validation

WIP before the spec is ready.

Validate the combination of the flavor extra-specs and image properties
as early as possible once they're both known (since you can specify
mutually-incompatible changes in the two places). If validation failed
then synchronously return error to user. We'd need to do this anywhere
the flavor or image changes, so basically instance creation, rebuild,
and resize.

blueprint: flavor-extra-spec-image-property-validation
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/618542
Change-Id: I06fad233006c7bab14749a51ffa226c3801f951b
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-12-10 22:02:01.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Flavor extra spec and image properties validation

WIP before the spec is ready.

Validate the combination of the flavor extra-specs and image properties
as early as possible once they're both known (since you can specify
mutually-incompatible changes in the two places). If validation failed
then synchronously return error to user. We need to do this anywhere
the flavor or image changes, so basically instance creation, rebuild,
and resize.

"}, {'created': '2019-01-09 22:33:35.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Flavor extra spec and image properties validation

Validate the combination of the flavor extra-specs and image properties
as early as possible once they're both known (since you can specify
mutually-incompatible changes in the two places). If validation failed
then synchronously return error to user. We need to do this anywhere
the flavor or image changes, so basically instance creation, rebuild,

blueprint: flavor-extra-spec-image-property-validation
Change-Id: I06fad233006c7bab14749a51ffa226c3801f951b
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-01-09 22:59:25.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Flavor extra spec and image properties validation

Validate the combination of the flavor extra-specs and image properties
as early as possible once they're both known (since you can specify
mutually-incompatible changes in the two places). If validation failed
then synchronously return error to user. We need to do this anywhere
the flavor or image changes, so basically instance creation, rebuild,
and resize.

- Rename _check_requested_image() to _validate_flavor_image() and call
  it from instance creation, rebuild, and resize.
- Call hardware.numa_get_constraints() at instance creation, rebuild,
  and resize to validate numa related request from flavor and image,
  including cpu policy, cpu thread policy, cpu topology etc.
- Validate serial ports before booting the instance.

blueprint: flavor-extra-spec-image-property-validation
Change-Id: I06fad233006c7bab14749a51ffa226c3801f951b
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-01-09 23:03:37.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Flavor extra spec and image properties validation

Validate the combination of the flavor extra-specs and image properties
as early as possible once they're both known (since you can specify
mutually-incompatible changes in the two places). If validation failed
then synchronously return error to user. We need to do this anywhere
the flavor or image changes, so basically instance creation, rebuild,
and resize.

- Rename _check_requested_image() to _validate_flavor_image() and call
  it from instance creation, rebuild, and resize.
- Call hardware.numa_get_constraints() at instance creation, rebuild,
  and resize to validate numa related request from flavor and image,
  including cpu policy, cpu thread policy, cpu topology etc.
- Validate serial ports before booting the instance.

blueprint: flavor-extra-spec-image-property-validation

Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>

mutually-incompatible changes in the two places). If validation failed
then synchronously return error to user. We need to do this anywhere

- Call hardware.numa_get_constraints() at instance creation, rebuild,

  including cpu policy, cpu thread policy, cpu topology etc.
- Rename _check_requested_image() to _validate_flavor_image() and call

  mask, cpu topology.

"}, {'created': '2019-01-15 20:13:40.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Flavor extra spec and image properties validation

Validate the combination of the flavor extra-specs and image properties
as early as possible once they're both known (since you can specify
mutually-incompatible changes in the two places). If validation failed
then synchronously return error to user. We need to do this anywhere
the flavor or image changes, so basically instance creation, rebuild,
and resize.

- Call hardware.numa_get_constraints() at instance creation, rebuild,
  and resize to validate numa related request from flavor and image,
  including cpu policy, cpu thread policy, cpu topology etc.
- Rename _check_requested_image() to _validate_flavor_image() and call
  it from instance creation, rebuild, and resize.
- Added the following validations to _validate_flavor_image():
  cpu_policy and cpu_thread_policy values, serial ports, realtime
  mask, cpu topology.

"}, {'created': '2019-03-04 17:31:40.000000000', 'message': "Flavor extra spec and image properties validation

Validate the combination of the flavor extra-specs and image properties
as early as possible once they're both known (since you can specify
mutually-incompatible changes in the two places). If validation failed
then synchronously return error to user. We need to do this anywhere
the flavor or image changes, so basically instance creation, rebuild,
and resize.

- Rename _check_requested_image() to _validate_flavor_image() and add
  a call from the resize code path.  (It's already called for create
  and rebuild.)
- In _validate_flavor_image() add new checks to validate numa related
  options from flavor and image including CPU policy, CPU thread
  policy, CPU topology, memory topology, hugepages, CPU pinning,
  serial ports, realtime mask, etc.
- Added new 400 exceptions in Server API correspondent to added
  validations.

PciInvalidAlias wasn't currently being handled, so I've added it to
the list of handled exceptions. (Thanks to mriedem for catching this.)

blueprint: flavor-extra-spec-image-property-validation
Change-Id: I06fad233006c7bab14749a51ffa226c3801f951b
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>

  policy, CPU topology, memory topology, hugepages, CPU pinning,
  serial ports, realtime mask, etc.
- Added new 400 exceptions in Server API correspondent to added
  validations.

blueprint: flavor-extra-spec-image-property-validation
Change-Id: I06fad233006c7bab14749a51ffa226c3801f951b
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Flavor extra spec and image properties validation from API

Validate the combination of the flavor extra-specs and image properties
as early as possible once they're both known (since you can specify
mutually-incompatible changes in the two places). If validation failed
then synchronously return error to user. We need to do this anywhere
the flavor or image changes, so basically instance creation, rebuild,
and resize.

- Rename _check_requested_image() to _validate_flavor_image() and add
  a call from the resize code path.  (It's already called for create
  and rebuild.)
- In _validate_flavor_image() add new checks to validate numa related
  options from flavor and image including CPU policy, CPU thread
  policy, CPU topology, memory topology, hugepages, CPU pinning,
  serial ports, realtime mask, etc.
- Added new 400 exceptions in Server API correspondent to added
  validations.

blueprint: flavor-extra-spec-image-property-validation
Change-Id: I06fad233006c7bab14749a51ffa226c3801f951b
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I98961f9a82a61e6fbcc5d741579c26460ab6b71b

commit_message:
Fixed wrong cinder store user name

The value for 'cinder_store_user_name' should be only user name
instead of tenant:username

Changing value of 'cinder_store_user_name' to 'glance' from
'service:glance'

Closes-Bug: #1809104
Change-Id: Idbc3541564fb405d60cf3dcc01960fd5e0befb97
(cherry picked from commit
1efe2a018a409d7d6a50a1a5d6155c72a08bfa73)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 03:14:16.000000000', 'message': "Override the 'get' method in DriverBlockDevice class

The following methods are overridden in DriverBlockDevice class.

* __getattr__
* __getitem__

The 'get' method is not overridden.
The value cannot be got by the 'get' method
though the value can be got by '__getattr__' (e.g. bdm.volumd_id)
or '__getitem__' (e.g. bdm['volume_id']) method.
So override the 'get' method to fix the issue.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py

    The conflict is due to not including
    Icc301230fe7c8e3ebbbcc7f4a807e562db7f93e3 in rocky.

Change-Id: Ic665fc1956831110937d98553e526cb909e49997
Closes-Bug: #1816938
(cherry picked from commit 3c66b40dbd23e3f792a86da5a15c993c52c9b377)
(cherry picked from commit ae40ceba8420b3b6c4bd8e29cf95ec21fd20e1e8)
"}]
commit_message:
Override the 'get' method in DriverBlockDevice class

The following methods are overridden in DriverBlockDevice class.

* __getattr__
* __getitem__

The 'get' method is not overridden.
The value cannot be got by the 'get' method
though the value can be got by '__getattr__' (e.g. bdm.volumd_id)
or '__getitem__' (e.g. bdm['volume_id']) method.
So override the 'get' method to fix the issue.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py

    The conflict is due to not including
    Icc301230fe7c8e3ebbbcc7f4a807e562db7f93e3 in rocky.

Change-Id: Ic665fc1956831110937d98553e526cb909e49997
Closes-Bug: #1816938
(cherry picked from commit 3c66b40dbd23e3f792a86da5a15c993c52c9b377)
(cherry picked from commit ae40ceba8420b3b6c4bd8e29cf95ec21fd20e1e8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 06:57:34.000000000', 'message': "Choose random value for HA routes' vr_id

HA routers are using keepalived and needs to have virtual_router_id
configured. As routers which belongs to same tenant are using same
ha network, those values have to be different for each router.

Before this patch this value was always taken as first available value
from available_vr_ids range.
In some (rare) cases, when more than one router is created in parallel
for same tenant it may happen that those routers would have same vr_id
choosen so keepalived would treat them as single application and only
one router would be ACTIVE on one of L3 agents.

This patch changes this behaviour that now random value from available
vr_ids will be chosen instead of taking first value always.
That should mittigate this rare race condition that it will be (almost)
not noticable for users.

However, proper fix should be probably done as some additional
constraint in database layer. But such solution wouldn't be possible to
backport to stable branches so I decided to propose this easy patch
first.

Change-Id: Idb0ed744e54976dca23593fb2d7317bf77442e65
Related-Bug: #1823314
(cherry picked from commit a8d0f557d504957aeb91f451105cca9eee2d6adb)
"}]
commit_message:
Choose random value for HA routes' vr_id

HA routers are using keepalived and needs to have virtual_router_id
configured. As routers which belongs to same tenant are using same
ha network, those values have to be different for each router.

Before this patch this value was always taken as first available value
from available_vr_ids range.
In some (rare) cases, when more than one router is created in parallel
for same tenant it may happen that those routers would have same vr_id
choosen so keepalived would treat them as single application and only
one router would be ACTIVE on one of L3 agents.

This patch changes this behaviour that now random value from available
vr_ids will be chosen instead of taking first value always.
That should mittigate this rare race condition that it will be (almost)
not noticable for users.

However, proper fix should be probably done as some additional
constraint in database layer. But such solution wouldn't be possible to
backport to stable branches so I decided to propose this easy patch
first.

Change-Id: Idb0ed744e54976dca23593fb2d7317bf77442e65
Related-Bug: #1823314
(cherry picked from commit a8d0f557d504957aeb91f451105cca9eee2d6adb)

like the rest of the cloud layer. At some point in the past that

subject: Automatically resume after openstack upgrade
messages:
[{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-04-16 15:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-04-16 16:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-04-16 18:15:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2019-04-16 21:07:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Overall, the change looks fine.

I'm a little concerned that this will auto-resume the service after a pause and that's a change in behavior and inconsistent with other charms. A note should be placed in the release notes and we should consider whether or not that should be made the same throughout other charms.

But for now, +2"}]

commit_message:
Automatically resume after openstack upgrade

After an openstack upgrade automatically resume. Without this a gate in
config_changed stops configuration of keystone catalog entries. That
gate is still useful for the series-upgrade process.

Change-Id: I458a1ed6ebf51263785391785cabc17f716b6178
Closes-Bug: #1824545

commit_message:
Check rabbitmq policy configuration task

This patch aims to test changes offered in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/652187/1 in order to test them in gate
before merging and distributing among repositories.

commit_message:
Change default local ovs connection timeout

Large number of flows can cause local ovs connection
timeout. Ultimately getting succeed will be better
than a retry or fullsync.

Related-Bug: #1813703
Related-Bug: #1813705
Related-Bug: #1813707
Related-Bug: #1813709

Change-Id: Ifa0608a7e131df3cad2f7727426720afce641a58
(cherry picked from commit 64ea642359e8f8aee2ebe494e037ecdfe8cf1b2c)

commit_message:
Add rocky standalone job

This job is needed as a comparison with osp-14.
The job is added as non-voting to the
tripleo-standalone-scenarios-full template
for testing.

Added to tripleo-standalone-scenarios-full for testing.
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/951?milestone=226267

Change-Id: I9d21887e4b681c644dc40a4741cf1885512c2c3c

commit_message:
MetricsQdr: Add InternalTLS support

- securing the Internal "MetricsQdr" connections
  with TLS support.

Depends-On: I30142db8bfa55412b8c8224aeb05916184117a86
Change-Id: I4d7d35efd8f3d11ff6cdee100ae720f828c8c364

subject: Qdr: InternalTLS support.

[{'account_id': 28504, 'date': '2019-01-16 18:33:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-01-16 19:38:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

This looks good! Is this service fronted by haproxy? Where is the service configuration for this? We need to tell the service to use TLS (with the specific cert and key) or if it doesn't support TLS, we need to configure a proxy for it."}, {'account_id': 28504, 'date': '2019-01-16 21:50:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This looks good! Is this service fronted by haproxy? Where is the
 > service configuration for this? We need to tell the service to use
 > TLS (with the specific cert and key) or if it doesn't support TLS,
 > we need to configure a proxy for it.

The service is not fronted by haproxy. And how can I know if this service supports being run by enabling TLS."}, {'account_id': 28504, 'date': '2019-01-16 22:41:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-01-17 05:20:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

> The service is not fronted by haproxy. And how can I know if this service supports being run by enabling TLS.

you can only know by reading the project's documentation or source code.

> I'm not sure how it is handled.?.But Definitely it is containerized, does that mean it is not handled by systemctl..?

right, at this point in time, docker needs to be called to restart or reload the service"}, {'account_id': 28504, 'date': '2019-01-18 14:30:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28504, 'date': '2019-01-24 15:02:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 22954, 'date': '2019-02-01 08:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Qdr: InternalTLS support.

Configuration changes to provide Internal TLS support
for Qdr.

Change-Id: I30142db8bfa55412b8c8224aeb05916184117a86

subject: Convert dict keys received in _ClientChannel from byte to str
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-20 17:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-20 21:33:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Fascinating. Python 2 will let a str key update a unicode key, but Python 3 won't let a bytes key update a str key. Since __dict__ uses str keys, we need to as well when updating it. Nice find!

I think my main question is why the message is coming through all in bytes. It seems like there is something wrong in the serialization layer if that's the case, because it doesn't look like the dict we passed in from the log handler used bytes. I'm _guessing_ it has something to do with use_bin_type in https://github.com/openstack/oslo.privsep/blob/master/oslo_privsep/comm.py#L54 but I don't understand why that's there enough to remove it (and it breaks a unit test if I do).

I guess this change only affects log messages so we can probably go with it, but I wonder if we're going to have issues in Python 3 elsewhere if types in dicts are getting changed like this.

-1 mostly for the comment in daemon.py, but it would be nice to understand why the dict is getting turned into bytes too (and how to stop it from happening, of course ;-)."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-21 09:40:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

I didn't find yet the root cause of this problem. Could be (must be) something related to PyCharm, because when I execute the functional tests (OpenStack Neutron, Nova, etc) with tox, there is no problem."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-21 09:44:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-21 16:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-21 16:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-21 18:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

-W, waiting for reply'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-27 12:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-27 15:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:17:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-03-04 17:58:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Ben, what's your opinion about the refactor in PS4? Thank you in advance."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-03-05 23:22:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

This seems safer than forcing everything to str. I'm not crazy about adding overhead to production code to support a debug use case, but I guess there's an argument that this could ease upgrades too in case the privsep daemon somehow ends up running under a different version of Python than the main process.

I would still prefer to hold off on merging this during feature freeze. I _think_ it should be a noop in normal use, but as it's not fixing a production bug I don't think there's any rush to get it in this cycle."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-03-05 23:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-03-06 09:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-03-11 19:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-03-11 20:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Stein is out the door, so let's get this in. Thanks for your patience."}]

commit_message:
Convert dict keys received in _ClientChannel from byte to str

When executing in debug mode, the arguments passed to [1] are stored
in a dictionary populated with bytes instead of strings. When in [2]
"record" is created and updated [3], the values contained in "msg[1]"
are not updated in "record"

This patch converts all keys in byte format to string (Python 3).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.privsep/blob/130d7155c4dcbbf170a0210ac72e302538fb26e4/oslo_privsep/comm.py#L128
[2] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.privsep/blob/130d7155c4dcbbf170a0210ac72e302538fb26e4/oslo_privsep/daemon.py#L210
[3] https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/b5409dacc4885146a27d06482b346e55fa12d2ec/Lib/logging/__init__.py#L415

Change-Id: Idec9ecc9fcc8c5b6779e0194a16cd861c7895d7e
Closes-Bug: #1816804

Allow to disable Container Healthchecks

A new parameter, ContainerHealthcheckDisabled allows an operator to
disable the container healthcheck when Podman is enabled.

Depends-On: Ic3dd492405b11ec482ff86e1513149c3eceb370f
Change-Id: Id8d7e21d58cf5ab155404db597d96665b94d7c2a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-23 15:46:06.000000000', 'message': 'WiP: Make krb-service-principal metadata per-Role

Not all roles are connected to all networks, there is no
need to create metadata for networks not associated with
the role.

In edge/spine-and-leaf deployments the total number of
composable networks used can be high. Passing all the
networks we quickly go beyond the nova metadata fields
size limit (each field cannot exceed 256 bytes).

Also update tools/check-up-to-date.sh script to use the
simple yaml-diff.py instead of diff. The env generator
code will sort data, while jinja rendered environments
are not sorted, thus need to diff the data in yaml not
the text.

Closes-Bug: #1821377
Change-Id: I5ae3bc845b0a6ad6986d44b14ff4b0737a9b033b

commit_message:
Make krb-service-principal metadata per-Role

Not all roles are connected to all networks, there is no
need to create metadata for networks not associated with
the role.

In edge/spine-and-leaf deployments the total number of
composable networks used can be high. Passing all the
networks we quickly go beyond the nova metadata fields
size limit (each field cannot exceed 256 bytes).

Also update tools/check-up-to-date.sh script to use the
simple yaml-diff.py instead of diff. The env generator
code will sort data, while jinja rendered environments
are not sorted, thus need to diff the data in yaml not
the text.

Closes-Bug: #1821377
Change-Id: I5ae3bc845b0a6ad6986d44b14ff4b0737a9b033b

commit_message:
Run octavia-api under apache

octavia-api uses wsgiref simpleserver which does not work well with
haproxy so we need to move to running it under apache.

Conflicts:
        manifests/profile/base/octavia/api.pp

Note: in addition to code conflicts, this patch introduces a
stable-branch-only change that checks if octavia is being deployed under
apache to continue supporting deployment templates that expect to
configure tls proxy if TLS is enabled.

Change-Id: I00f537ce27b1d4642738f0eb90d7ed1f2c21e729
(cherry picked from commit 5277954a766f83ff839f0eacdee37ed2d78d8d15)

commit_message:
Rename undercloud-neutron-sanity-check role

This patch renames it 'neutron-sanity-check' as we can use this role to not only
check the Undercloud Neutron configuration, but also on the Overcloud Controller.

It also adds the playbook to sanity check Neutron on the Controller.

Change-Id: I510bf5959b26cbe4bf2126842d335cf2a0cfddd8
Implements: blueprint validation-framework
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-03-07 11:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-03-15 08:15:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-03-15 09:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

hmm so this one is docker-only - we might want to make it a bit more generic in order to support podman?'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-03-15 09:21:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> hmm so this one is docker-only - we might want to make it a bit
 > more generic in order to support podman?

Yes that's being part of the plan and this will be included in a follow-up patch. 

The reason is this task needs time (especially testing) and I really need to know where I can get the information about docker/podman deployment. For the undercloud, I know that the information is coming from the container_cli var in the undercloud.conf. But for the overcloud, I know that THT is using ContainerCli var for that purpose but it doesn't seem to be exposed for outside use. 

The question is, How to get that information easily from the validations environment."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-03-15 09:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> > hmm so this one is docker-only - we might want to make it a bit
 > > more generic in order to support podman?
 > 
 > Yes that's being part of the plan and this will be included in a
 > follow-up patch.
 > 
 > The reason is this task needs time (especially testing) and I
 > really need to know where I can get the information about
 > docker/podman deployment. For the undercloud, I know that the
 > information is coming from the container_cli var in the
 > undercloud.conf. But for the overcloud, I know that THT is using
 > ContainerCli var for that purpose but it doesn't seem to be exposed
 > for outside use.
 > 
 > The question is, How to get that information easily from the
 > validations environment.

Fair enough - not sure about the way to get the "container_cli" for the overcloud :/. Will try to dig a bit on my side.

Maybe ensure we're running this validation on a docker environment? There are multiple examples for that iirc. That would be the least I guess.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-03-15 09:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-03-15 13:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-03-18 11:52:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-03-18 12:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-03-20 13:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
debian: add ci and update meta

This patch adds the Debian jobs for this role to make sure
it's always passing as well as updates the meta to reflect
it's support of Debian accordingly.

Depends-On: I135ea73604890eae5e9e2a7cdcab81b2b39ad426
Change-Id: Iae0e172bac0abfdbc2d06f0b3778649de6749305
(cherry picked from commit c101353ab6e1f7b08e570667f1bdccb14db92de1)

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

commit_message:
debian: add ci and update meta

This patch adds the Debian jobs for this role to make sure
it's always passing as well as updates the meta to reflect
it's support of Debian accordingly.

Depends-On: I9a92b73c419a0dc1cca40dacfef75de61a61db94
Change-Id: I51554e4ed0ce8a29566ee4993ba0216ad63a90ce
(cherry picked from commit 8b2139602eff3ace6e841d082c2df1b5dd3ce2e7)

commit_message:
ceph-provisioners: Add pod/container security context

This updates the ceph-provisioners  chart to include the pod
security context on the pod template

This also adds the container security context to set allowPrivilegeEscalation
to false and readOnlyRootFilesystem to true

Change-Id: Iee49ffe17f2cd08fc978461269b654d3b2cb4406

(1 comment)

Thanks for sticking with this Maciej. This is a buttload of code and I think we've done as much test coverage as we can. I honestly expect a bug or two just given the rule of how many bugs per lines of code, so it's better to get this in earlier than later. I'm still a bit uneasy about iterating all cells while running this migration as well since that's typically not what we do for an online data migration that needs to hit just a single cell database, but as noted in an earlier review comment we don't really have any hard and fast rules about that (and I'm sure some operators would like to just be able to run the online data migrations once from one spot with one set of configs rather than have to run them all for each cell database config like I imagine CERN has to), and as long as the marker strategy works here then running this per cell should be essentially a noop after the first one does the migration for *all* cells."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-01-30 14:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

Excellent work, and thank you, Maciej!

-jay'}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2019-01-30 16:57:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)

I guess the approach is similar to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582536 and request spec migration that we have except that its per cell based migration so at the end of running it for the first time through all the cells, each cell will be left with a FAKE_UUID VirtualInterface object/marker so that it doesn't process all the cell instances again and again. Having said that however, until all the cells are processed for the first time like if its a deployment having a lot of cells, since we don't know which cell we exactly stopped at, everytime we would have to enter each cell and fetch the persistent marker and move to the next cell if it was an already processed cell. So until we reach cell70 and finish off it will go through every DB from cell0. I guess I would have been personally happier off without making this multi-cell aware, but since I am late to the party, we will keep it in mind that this migration will loop through all the cells together and to have the api_database config set in config file."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-30 22:56:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-30 22:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 10:10:21.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add online_data_migration script

In change [1] we modified _heal_instance_info_cache periodic task
to use Neutron point of view while rebuilding InstanceInfoCache
objets.
The crucial point was how we know the previous order of ports, if
the cache was broken. We decided to use VirtualInterfaceList objects
as source of port order.
For instances older than Newton VirtualInterface objects doesn't
exist, so we need to introduce a way of creating it.
This script should be executed while upgrading to Stein release.

[1] review.openstack.org/#/c/591607

Change-Id: Ic26d4ce3d071691a621d3c925dc5cd436b2005f1
Related-Bug: 1751923

"}, {'created': '2018-10-31 14:56:57.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add fill_virtual_interface_list online_data_migration script

In change [1] we modified _heal_instance_info_cache periodic task
to use Neutron point of view while rebuilding InstanceInfoCache
objets.
The crucial point was how we know the previous order of ports, if
the cache was broken. We decided to use VirtualInterfaceList objects
as source of port order.
For instances older than Newton VirtualInterface objects doesn't
exist, so we need to introduce a way of creating it.
This script should be executed while upgrading to Stein release.

commit_message:
Add fill_virtual_interface_list online_data_migration script

In change [1] we modified _heal_instance_info_cache periodic task
to use Neutron point of view while rebuilding InstanceInfoCache
objects.
The crucial point was how we know the previous order of ports, if
the cache was broken. We decided to use VirtualInterfaceList objects
as source of port order.
For instances older than Newton VirtualInterface objects doesn't
exist, so we need to introduce a way of creating it.
This script should be executed while upgrading to Stein release.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591607

Change-Id: Ic26d4ce3d071691a621d3c925dc5cd436b2005f1
Related-Bug: 1751923

commit_message:
Report SolidFire number of object to scheduler

The SolidFire has a hardlimit for the number of volumes and accounts.
If it exceeded, The SolidFire return xExceededLimit error,
As a result cinder volume create will have failed in spite of
the SolidFire backend has sufficient available capacity.
After that, Cinder scheduler choose same backend
because Cinder scheduler uses CapacityWeigher by default.

As a result, It will be fail "cinder volume create" operation again.
To avoid such problems, To avoid such problems,
Cinder administrator need be able to specify
the number of volumes and accounts in goodness_function.

This patch add variable volumes and accounts count
to _update_cluster_status methods.

Change-Id: I12fb52eb16897ea98c0037be4f687b5071f0e9bd
Implements: blueprint solidfire-report-object-count

commit_message:
[WIP][POC] Add store driver for scheduler host manager

Introduce backend store for scheduler's host manager
and move collect, update and query volume backend status
operations into backend store.

Change-Id: Iefc1e20ed3881d9b7ae8eb0c4521868fd4fea70b

subject: Release openstack/manila 6.3.0 off of stable/queens
messages:
[{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-15 20:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-04-15 20:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-16 02:38:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-16 18:23:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm assuming the minor version bump is due to "Only allow IP access type for CephFS NFS"? Sounds like anything other than the IP would not work before. Is that intentional to not just make this a 6.2.1 release?'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-04-16 18:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Sean - we also have that dell-emc vmax config backport that makes the best of broken config options introduced back in ocata.  Without going into it all again, we aren't breaking backwards compatability but do "creatively" introduce some options that weren't there before.  When we discussed a release containing this backport for stable/pike we ended up deciding this level of semvar bump was appropriate.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-16 18:47:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Ah, that's right. Thanks Tom!"}]
revisions:

Change-Id: Iac53f81ea6e5b596315063197a8a8d50188f6353
'}]

Release openstack/manila 6.3.0 off of stable/queens

Change-Id: Iac53f81ea6e5b596315063197a8a8d50188f6353

messages:
[{'account_id': 28526, 'date': '2018-06-26 08:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-26 08:56:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2018-06-26 10:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- dsvm-tempest-infinibox-fc http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/34/578034/1/check/dsvm-tempest-infinibox-fc/b2f4c5d : SUCCESS in 1h 06m 29s
- dsvm-tempest-infinibox-iscsi http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/34/578034/1/check/dsvm-tempest-infinibox-iscsi/9242123 : SUCCESS in 1h 05m 40s'}, {'account_id': 24863, 'date': '2018-06-26 10:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed. For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- dsvm-veritas-access-cinder-driver http://52.42.67.99/34/578034/1/check/dsvm-veritas-access-cinder-driver/b79678e : SUCCESS in 1h 17m 16s
- dsvm-veritas-access-cinder-iscsi-driver http://52.42.67.99/34/578034/1/check/dsvm-veritas-access-cinder-iscsi-driver/bf938c3 : FAILURE in 1h 23m 30s'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2018-06-26 11:46:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hi Emilien, good to have you on OpenStack. So, can you give in the commit message a description of the use case for this change, the problem being solved and how this will address it?

Also, I'm a bit concerned about the amount of information that should be added in the scheduler stats. There are some cases where the host has thousands of volumes. So, depending on the use case, if that is not something that will broadly be used, we should consider adding this as an option."}, {'account_id': 18883, 'date': '2018-06-26 12:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- xiv-tempest-dsvm-full-iscsi http://dal05.objectstorage.softlayer.net/v1/AUTH_0bd27569-6310-44fc-8a8d-36a112cac4ec/IBM-STORAGE-CI/xiv-tempest-dsvm-full-iscsi/None : RETRY_LIMIT'}, {'account_id': 24814, 'date': '2018-06-26 12:43:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

* HPMSA-FC http://os-logs.tristero.net/hpmsa-ci/34/578034/1/HPMSA-FC : SUCCESS in 33:06.50
* HPMSA-iSCSI http://os-logs.tristero.net/hpmsa-ci/34/578034/1/HPMSA-iSCSI : SUCCESS in 35:54.94'}, {'account_id': 24815, 'date': '2018-06-26 12:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

* Lenovo-FC http://os-logs.tristero.net/lenovo-ci/34/578034/1/Lenovo-FC : SUCCESS in 38:55.88
* Lenovo-iSCSI http://os-logs.tristero.net/lenovo-ci/34/578034/1/Lenovo-iSCSI : SUCCESS in 43:04.84'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-26 15:05:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I agree with Erlon. With large deployments with many volumes, this could really have a performance impact. I think there's probably a more efficient way to do this, but would like to see more about the use case for having this.

The blueprint does have more detail, so I'll have to read through that again and think about it some more."}, {'account_id': 21976, 'date': '2018-06-26 15:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-iscsi http://54.209.116.144/34/578034/1/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-iscsi/1d90973 : SUCCESS in 1h 51m 42s
- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC http://54.209.116.144/34/578034/1/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC/89c513e : SUCCESS in 1h 58m 02s'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2018-06-27 00:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- cinder-iscsi-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//cinder/578034/1/iscsi/ : SUCCESS in 1h 21m 23s
- cinder-smb3-windows-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//cinder/578034/1/smb3_windows/ : SUCCESS in 2h 02m 03s'}, {'account_id': 28526, 'date': '2018-06-27 14:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-06-27 14:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

This kind of change should have an associated cinder-spec that discusses the design.
    https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/cinder-specs/tree/README.rst'}, {'account_id': 28526, 'date': '2018-06-27 15:01:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Hi Emilien, good to have you on OpenStack. So, can you give in the
 > commit message a description of the use case for this change, the
 > problem being solved and how this will address it?
 > 
 > Also, I'm a bit concerned about the amount of information that
 > should be added in the scheduler stats. There are some cases where
 > the host has thousands of volumes. So, depending on the use case,
 > if that is not something that will broadly be used, we should
 > consider adding this as an option.

Hi, I have added some comments and add more informations in commit message. I made some modifications to allow to disable this new property and to set a minimum value before sending project volumes_on_host to the scheduler, to reduce the amount of information.

Thank you for your quick support"}, {'account_id': 24863, 'date': '2018-06-27 16:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build failed. For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

This new property allows us (public cloud provider) to reduce the weight of a backend according to the number of volumes owned by the tenant residing on this backend.
We need that possibility to prevent one user spawning multiple, empty volumes who will be placed by the scheduler on only the backend with the higher goodness score.

commit_message:
Add a project.volumes_on_host weigher property for custom goodness function

This new property allows us (public cloud provider) to reduce the weight of a backend according to the number of volumes owned by the tenant residing on this backend.
We need that possibility to prevent one user spawning multiple, empty volumes who will be placed by the scheduler on only the backend with the higher goodness score.
Otherwise if this user starts to fill all his volumes, at the same time, it can decrease performance and overfill this backend. This can have an impact other customers.

Add append_projects_stats method to VolumeManager, (look at volumes in DB by host, and count project_id), with an option to set a threshold before passing volume on host stats to scheduler.
Add project key to goodness weigher custom functions.
Add a option to enable / disable this property (disabled by default).
Also provide a test case to validate.

Change-Id: I2702ad704ed70bb0ce27a57492f8eb91e827ad9b
Implements: blueprint cinder-weigher-new-property

commit_message:
Add a spec to add a new  weigher property for custom goodness function

This new property allows us (public cloud provider) to reduce
the weight of a backend according to the number of volumes
owned by the tenant residing on this backend.

Change-Id: Ief70e37e6fd8b8f9be9cf17a7ac99ef15125e1d8
